name: places/ChIJH9QMHpVZwokR6Xcard6Nesc
formattedAddress: 68 E 11th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 68 E 11th St, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text:
The woman with blonde hair and the guy outside with longer hair are awesome! So professional, kind and efficient. I booked the car only 30 minutes before and was given a beautiful clean vehicle and we were ready to go!
I watched as the lady at the counter patiently explained the agreement to a European couple. It was challenging because they didn’t understand or kept interrupting and she remained calm, professional and spoke to them in clear terms using simple words so they could understand. I work in customer service and I really admired the way she took care of these people who needed extra attention. I hope I can be as patient and kind as she was.
Amazing experience to find not just a car, but people whose traits one wishes to emulate.

originalText.text:
TLDR: Avis charged me for a parking ticket that was given an hour before the car was in my possession and has not be helpful in resolving this.

I received an unauthorized charge on my card for a parking ticket for $157 that was issued at Avis’s location: 66 E 11th New York, New York at 8:08AM on 9/26/23. I disputed this with my bank and somehow lost the dispute. Although my reservation was supposed to be at 8AM, I did not actually receive the keys to the car until closer to 9AM due to the computer system being down and I had to fill out information by hand and wait patiently to receive my car. The car was parked on the street when we picked it up. It is unacceptable to make a customer pay for a ticket that the car received prior to even having possession of the car.

originalText.text:
This Avis is the closest car rental place to my work and therefore is routinely used by myself and other employees. For example, I rented 7 cars in 2023 from this location. The last three rental cars were disgusting. Trash in the center consoles at pickup, sticky surfaces, leaking liquids, smells. The worst part is after the last rental I received a fine of $450 ( a letter arrived in the mail a month and a half after drop off) for pet fur in the back seat. This is impossible. 1. I used this car for a work commute and did not use the back seat, 2. no one else got in the vehicle, and 3. I have no pets to produce fur. Ridiculous but per “rental policy” you have no fight.

The only redeeming fact is my place of employment has now 100% banned this office from rentals as others have had similar complaints (amounts to over 1000 car rentals/ year lost for this office). Avoid this scammy and gross place at all costs.

originalText.text: I rented a car from Avis in Greenwich Village and it was SO easy! I had Donna Longo help me and she had a clean car ready and waiting for me in 10 minutes. I’ve rented cars in downtown NYC other places before and I usually wait forever or they run out of cars. But she was wonderful and I will rent from Avis again for sure!

text.text: I rented a car from Avis in Greenwich Village and it was SO easy! I had Donna Longo help me and she had a clean car ready and waiting for me in 10 minutes. I’ve rented cars in downtown NYC other places before and I usually wait forever or they run out of cars. But she was wonderful and I will rent from Avis again for sure!

originalText.text:
The car we rented was NOT mantained at all. It was given to us dirty on the outside and the insidie. As soon as we took off, the low tire pressure alarm came up. We called them and they told us it was fine. It wasn't. The tire had a huge damage and every 3-4 hours we had to constantly refill with air. The washer fluid was low also. This is not ok from a company like Avis. We also asked to have the etoll unlimited but they "forgot to add it". Thankfully we called them and they should have add it. Shout out to the security guy who was nice to us, but apart from him everything has been a total disaster.

EDIT: Avis asked us in the commenti below to contact them directly through a DM which is not possibile on this platform. If they could provide us an email address, like the others, that would be great. Otherwise it's pointless.
